nodes.name: Verify Output Files and Get Sizes

assignments.name: message
assignments.value: ⚠️ No files found to convert with the specified parameters

assignments.name: details
assignments.value: Please check: 1) Source folder path exists, 2) File extension is correct, 3) Files exist in the specified location

parameters.content:
## 🏁 GROUP 1: INITIALIZATION

**Nodes in this group:**
• Manual Trigger
• Capture Pipeline Start Time
• Set Configuration Parameters
• Merge Pipeline Start with Config

**What happens here:**
1️⃣ Pipeline starts manually or on schedule
2️⃣ Current timestamp is captured for metrics
3️⃣ All settings are loaded (paths, folders, etc.)
4️⃣ Configuration merged with timing data

💡 **Key:** This sets up everything needed for the conversion process

## 🔍 GROUP 2: FILE DISCOVERY

**Nodes in this group:**
• Find CAD Files
• Merge Config with Search Results
• Process File List
• Check if Files Exist

**What happens here:**
1️⃣ PowerShell scans the source folder
2️⃣ Filters files by extension (.rvt, .ifc, etc.)
3️⃣ Creates a list with full paths
4️⃣ Validates that files were found

📁 **Output:** Array of file objects with paths
❌ **If no files:** Pipeline stops gracefully

## 🔄 GROUP 3: BATCH PREPARATION

**Nodes in this group:**
• Split Files for Processing
• Create Output Directory
• Merge File Data

**What happens here:**
1️⃣ File list is split into individual items
2️⃣ Output directory is created (if needed)
3️⃣ Each file gets conversion parameters

🎯 **Purpose:** Enables parallel processing
📊 **Data added:** Expected output paths for XLSX & DAE

## ⚡ GROUP 4: CONVERSION EXECUTION

**Nodes in this group:**
• Capture Start Time
• Small Delay
• Execute Conversion
• Calculate Conversion Time

**What happens here:**
1️⃣ Timestamp captured for each file
2️⃣ Small delay prevents overload
3️⃣ RvtExporter.exe runs the conversion
4️⃣ Processing time calculated

🔧 **Command:** 
`RvtExporter.exe [input] [output.xlsx] [output.dae]`

⏱️ **Conversion Time:** 1 Minute per 100Mb.

## ✅ GROUP 5: VALIDATION

**Nodes in this group:**
• Merge Data Before Verification
• Verify Output Files and Get Sizes
• Complete File Verification

**What happens here:**
1️⃣ All conversion data is consolidated
2️⃣ PowerShell checks if outputs exist
3️⃣ File sizes are measured
4️⃣ Success/failure status determined

**Success criteria:**
• Both XLSX and DAE files exist
• File sizes > 0 bytes
• No conversion errors

## 📊 GROUP 6: REPORTING

**Nodes in this group:**
• Generate HTML Report
• Prepare Binary Data
• Save HTML File

**What happens here:**
1️⃣ All results compiled into statistics
2️⃣ Professional HTML report generated
3️⃣ Report saved to output folder

**Report includes:**
• Success rate & metrics
• Processing times
• File sizes & links
• Detailed conversion log

## 🎯 GROUP 7: FINALIZATION

**Nodes in this group:**
• Verify and Prepare Path
• Open HTML Report
• Final Completion Notice

**What happens here:**
1️⃣ Report path normalized for Windows
2️⃣ HTML report opens in browser
3️⃣ Success message displayed

**Final output:**
• Report auto-opens
• Summary in console
• All files ready for use

## 🚀 CAD/BIM Batch Conversion Pipeline

**What this pipeline does:**
- 🔍 **Finds** all CAD files in your folder (and subfolders)
- 🔄 **Converts** all CAD/BIM data to Excel (DataFrame) + 3D formats
- ✅ **Validates** conversion success
- 📊 **Generates** detailed HTML report
- 🎯 **Opens** report automatically

**Supported formats:**
`.rvt` `.ifc` `.dwg` `.dgn`

## 📋 Quick Start Guide

**1️⃣ Configure Settings**
Edit "Set Configuration Parameters":
- `converter_path`: Path to RvtExporter.exe
- `source_folder`: Your CAD files location
- `output_folder`: Where to save results
- `file_extension`: .rvt, .ifc, .dwg, or .dgn

**2️⃣ Run Pipeline**
Click "Execute Workflow"

**3️⃣ Get Results**
✅ Excel data files
✅ 3D DAE models
✅ HTML report

## 🎓 Video Tutorials

**📹 [CAD-BIM Pipeline Tutorial](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PMTZNRFjD6c)**
Complete walkthrough of CAD-BIM automation

**⚡ [Automated Validation](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=p84AmP2dcvg)**
Stop manual BIM checking forever

💡 **Pro tip:** Watch before first run!

## 💡 Pro Tips

• Start small (5-10 files)
• Test with different file types
• Run overnight for large batches
• Keep source files backed up
• Close CAD applications first

**Optimization:**
• SSD = 2-3x faster
• More RAM = stability
• Exclude huge files initially

## 📈 Pipeline Metrics

**Tracks:**
• Total pipeline time
• Per-file conversion time
• Success/failure rates
• Input/output file sizes
• Processing efficiency

**Typical performance:**
• Small files: 10-30 sec
• Medium: 30-60 sec
• Large: 1-3 min

## 🎯 Use Cases

**Weekly Reports**
Automate Monday conversions

**Quality Control**
Validate before client delivery

**Archive Projects**
Convert old files to lightweight formats

**BI Integration**
Feed Excel data to Power BI

## 📝 Configuration Example

```
converter_path: 
C:\DDC_Converter\RvtExporter.exe

source_folder: 
C:\Projects\Building_A

output_folder: 
C:\Projects\Converted

file_extension: .rvt
include_subfolders: false
```

⭐ **If you find our tools helpful**, please consider starring our repository on [GitHub](https://github.com/datadrivenconstruction/cad2data-Revit-IFC-DWG-DGN-pipeline-with-conversion-validation-qto). **Your support helps us** improve and continue developing open solutions for the community!

main.node: Verify Output Files and Get Sizes
